results.title: The War against the Indians
results.creator_credit: Harry Rasky and Canadian Broadcast Company
results.brief_description: War against the Indians traces the history of North American Indians from 40,000 years ago to the present day. Harry Rasky, writer, producer, director and narrator, questions many of the traditional beliefs about Indians from the point of view of Native Americans. Did Christopher Columbus discover the North American Indians? Don’t you have to be lost to be discovered? The North American Indians were already established and living off the land of North America, perhaps it was they who discovered Christopher Columbus and not the other way round. This documentary, put together with paintings, music, photographs and interviews reflects on their history.

results.title: Head
results.creator_credit: Bob Rafelson, Jack Nicholson, Columbia and Raybert Productions
results.brief_description: In search for meaning, U.S. sixties band The Monkees roll from one adventure to another in this hilarious plotless movie that manages to sum up the iconography of the day. Through an explosion of images from the sixties, the band bursts through with their silly antics and witty asides on a trajectory to pastiche some of the spirit the pop culture gave birth to in the 20th century. With a cast that includes The Monkees (Peter Tork, David Jones, Mickey Dolenz, Michael Nesmith), Victor Mature, Frank Zappa and Sonny Liston, ‘Head’ manages to turn everything back onto itself.

results.title: The Wisdom of crocodiles = Immortality
results.creator_credit: Po Chih Leong, Carolyn Choa, David Lascelles and Zenith Productions
results.brief_description: The Wisdom of crocodiles, directed by Hong Kong veteran director Po Chih Leong, is an elegant thriller set in contemporary London that combines the serial killer and vampire genres. Steven Grlscz is a charming, wealthy man who lures beautiful women and then subjects them to wicked, deathly pursuits. A sprucely variant of the Dracula myth, “The Wisdom of crocodiles” creates its central character, Grlscz, as a complex individual who lives alone in a gothic, decadent, highly ornamental London ‘pad’ and spends his spare time cataloguing the death of his victims. Grlscz’s killer instinct derives from the Dracula myth tradition: he kills in order to sustain his own well-being and life force. Though evidence points to Grlscz as a suspect, his brilliance outsmarts the police; in fact, Inspector Healey, the Catholic police inspector who tails Grlscz, comes to like and respect him after Grlscz saves his life. Soon enough, they develop a friendship and ruminate on philosophic matters of good and evil, black and white, marriage and fidelity, and so on. Steven’s killer instinct is challenged when he meets structural engineer, Anna Levels, whose combination of femininity and worldliness, sensuality and astuteness, vulnerability and independence, ultimately saves her life. Director Po Chih Leong and writer Paul Hoffman have created a sophisticated, engaging thriller that fits complex characters with gorgeous visuals and an inventive soundtrack. Cast includes Jude Law, Elina Lowensohn, Timothy Spall and Kerry Fox.

results.title: The Raven
results.creator_credit: Louis Friedlander, Carl Laemmle and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: A macabre horror classic from a story by Edgar Allen Poe, “The Raven” centres on a brilliant but unstable surgeon, Dr Richard Vollin (Bela Lugosi), with a morbid obsession for instruments of torture. When Jean Thatcher (Irene Ware), daughter of Judge Thatcher (Samuel S. Hinds) is injured in a car accident, it is Dr Vollin who steps in and saves her life. However, the beautiful Jean becomes frightened of Vollin’s increasing attraction and advances towards her and pleads to her father to ask Vollin to leave her alone. Vollin’s rejection turns to revenge when by chance, an escaped killer, Edmond Bateman (Boris Karloff), approaches the surgeon for a new face. Bateman unwittingly becomes a victim of Vollin’s sinister plan for the kidnap, torture and death of Jean and her fiance. This original version of “The Raven”, through its use of black and white cinematography, brings out the evil and horror in Poe’s classic tale - shadowy silhouettes, dark stormy nights, howling winds, flashes of lightning, hidden dungeons, torture chambers - all the necessary ingredients, plus the superb, if somewhat melodramatic, acting by the cast, particularly Boris Karloff and Bela Lugosi. Cast also includes Lester Matthews, Inez Courtney, Spencer Charters, Ian Wolfe, Maidel Turner. Screenplay by David Boehm.

results.title: Mad Dog and Glory
results.creator_credit: John McNaughton, Martin Scorsese, Barbara de Fina and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Robert De Niro and Uma Thurman star as title characters Mad Dog and Glory in this unassuming romantic comedy. A divorced evidence gathering policeman and aspiring photographer, Wayne “Mad Dog” Dobie earns his nickname in reference to his mild mannered nature. One night while on duty Mad Dog inadvertently saves the life of local gangster and part time comedian Frank Milo (a dour Bill Murray, cast against type). Under guidance from his therapist and eager to bring happiness to the life of someone who empathises with his desire to be someone else, Milo befriends Mad Dog and loans Glory (Thurman) to him for a week. Before the week is over Mad Dog and Glory have fallen in love and the two are faced with settling Glory’s brother’s gambling debt to Milo in exchange for their relationship. Cast also includes David Caruso and Mike Star as convincingly menancing sidekick heavyweights and Kathy Baker as Mad Dog’s neighbour.

results.title: The End of the affair
results.creator_credit: Neil Jordan, Stephen Woolley and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: During the Second World War, English novelist Maurice Bendrix (Ralph Fiennes) conducted a five year, illicit affair with a married woman (Julieanne Moore). Embittered and bewildered by his lover’s abrupt disappearance after a bomb attack, Maurice has the opportunity to re-enter Sarah’s life after he encounters her husband Henry (Stephen Rea) shortly after the war. Henry, who maintains a platonic relationship with his wife, suspects that she is having an affair and appeals to Maurice to help him find the truth. Overwhelmed by jealousy, Maurice enlists the services of a private detective on the pretext that he is helping Henry. As the film flashes between the present and the past, the motives for Sarah’s actions are gradually revealed. Graham Greene denied that his novel was based on his own affair with Catherine Walston, despite dedicating it to ‘C’ and giving Sarah’s husband the same name as Catherine’s husband. Cast includes Ian Hart and Jason Isaacs. Music composed and conducted by Michael Nyman. Editing, Tony Lawson. Cinematography, Roger Pratt. Written for the screen by Neil Jordan.

results.title: Marnie [DVD]
results.brief_description: Marnie is a psychodrama with a background of crime and suspense. Tippi Hedren is Marnie, a kleptomaniac and compulsive liar who goes to work as a secretary for Mark Rutland (Sean Connery), and then attempts to rob him. Upon discovering this, Rutland impulsively marries the troubled beauty and attempts to uncover the reasons for her obsessive behaviour and sexual frigidity. When a terrible accident pushes his wife to the edge, Rutland forces Marnie to confront her terrors and her past in a shattering conclusion. Includes music score by Bernard Herrmann. Cast includes Tippi Hedron, Sean Connery, Diane Baker, Martin Gabel, Louise Latham.

results.title: The Man who knew too much [DVD]
results.brief_description: Doctor Ben McKenna and his wife Jo take their ten year old son on holiday to Morocco and get caught up in a web of intrigue when he is kidnapped. They are forced to travel to London to find him which results in a memorable murder sequence at the Royal Albert Hall. Stars James Stewart and Doris Day. Screenplay by John Michael Hayes, based on the story by Chales Bennett and D. B. Wyndham-Lewis. Cinematography by Robert Burks.

results.title: Frenzy [DVD]
results.brief_description: Hitchcock’s penultimate film and his first made in England for 20 years, ‘Frenzy’ was concerned with many of the same preoccupations that dominated his earlier work including those around the motifs of the doppelganger, the wrong man and violent sexual deviance. Post-Carnaby London is terrorised by a rapist-murderer known as the ‘Necktie Killer’. An innocent ex-R.A.F. pilot, down on his luck, is accused of the murders and condemned to life imprisonment but a police inspector continues to have doubts about his guilt. Mixing black-humour and slapstick with disturbing sexual violence, the film received the critical praise denied his three previous films but was not a commercial success. Cast includes Jon Finch, Alec McCowen, Barry Foster and Barbara Leigh-Hunt. Screenplay by Anthony Schaffer, based on Arthur Le Bern’s novel ‘ Goodbye Piccadilly, Hello Leicester Square’. Photographed by Gil Taylor. Edited by John Jympson. Music by Ron Goodwin.

results.title: Girlfight
results.creator_credit: Karyn Kusama, Maggie Renzi, Martha Griffin, Sarah Green and Independent Film Channel
results.brief_description: Diana Guzman (Michelle Rodriguez) is a high school student at a Bronx school who is always getting into trouble. She’s not enough of a traditional girl for the kids at school and she does not get along with her father who she blames for her mother’s death. Diana’s brother is training to be a boxer and Diana starts to secretly steal money from her dad in order to learn to box herself. When she realises that she has real talent in the ring, she finds a purpose and a drive in life that she never thought she had. Karyn Kusama’s debut feature film is an exceptionally resonant and effective piece of filmmaking that superbly conveys the intimate story of a young Hispanic girl’s life. Eschewing conventional plotting by enfusing all the characters with ambiguity and complexity, “Girlfight” is a truly inspiring neo-feminist coming of age story. Both the female and male characters in the film are treated sensitively, and with a refreshing disavowal of the usual gender and racial stereotypes accorded to the representation of Hispanic Americans. The film won both the Directing and Grand Jury Prize at the 2000 Sundance Festival and there has also been international acclaim for Rodriguez whose feature film debut it is. The film also features a cameo appearance by independent filmmaker John Sayles who helped finance the film. The featurette accompanying this DVD features in-depth interviews with Kusama and with the actors in the film.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Karyn Kusama, Maggie Renzi, Martha Griffin, Sarah Green and Independent Film Channel

She’s not enough of a traditional girl for the kids at school and she does not get along with her father who she blames for her mother’s death. Diana’s brother is training to be a boxer and Diana starts to secretly steal money from her dad in order to learn to box herself. When she realises that she has real talent in the ring, she finds a purpose and a drive in life that she never thought she had. Karyn Kusama’s debut feature film is an exceptionally resonant and effective piece of filmmaking that superbly conveys the intimate story of a young Hispanic girl’s life. Eschewing conventional plotting by enfusing all the characters with ambiguity and complexity, “Girlfight” is a truly inspiring neo-feminist coming of age story. Both the female and male characters in the film are treated sensitively, and with a refreshing disavowal of the usual gender and racial stereotypes accorded to the representation of Hispanic Americans. The film won both the Directing and Grand Jury Prize at the 2000 Sundance Festival and there has also been international acclaim for Rodriguez whose feature film debut it is. The film also features a cameo appearance by independent filmmaker John Sayles who helped finance the film. The featurette accompanying this DVD features in-depth interviews with Kusama and with the actors in the film.
description_for_label: Diana Guzman (Michelle Rodriguez) is a high school student at a Bronx school who is always getting into trouble. She’s not enough of a traditional girl for the kids at school and she does not get along with her father who she blames for her mother’s death. Diana’s brother is training to be a boxer and Diana starts to secretly steal money from her dad in order to learn to box herself. When she realises that she has real talent in the ring, she finds a purpose and a drive in life that she never thought she had. Karyn Kusama’s debut feature film is an exceptionally resonant and effective piece of filmmaking that superbly conveys the intimate story of a young Hispanic girl’s life. Eschewing conventional plotting by enfusing all the characters with ambiguity and complexity, “Girlfight” is a truly inspiring neo-feminist coming of age story. Both the female and male characters in the film are treated sensitively, and with a refreshing disavowal of the usual gender and racial stereotypes accorded to the representation of Hispanic Americans. The film won both the Directing and Grand Jury Prize at the 2000 Sundance Festival and there has also been international acclaim for Rodriguez whose feature film debut it is. The film also features a cameo appearance by independent filmmaker John Sayles who helped finance the film. The featurette accompanying this DVD features in-depth interviews with Kusama and with the actors in the film.
